wikipedia_page.main: Rose Neill (born 1958) is a Northern Ireland news broadcaster, currently working for UTV. At the beginning of her career she was the youngest newsreader in the United Kingdom, and she is the longest-serving newscasters in the British Isles, having worked for 44 consecutive years newscasting .

response: The Malone Road area of Belfast has been home to many notable and historical people. From Moyses Hill, who received a 61-year lease in 1606Lamour, P. (1991). The Architectural Heritage of Malone and Stranmillis. UAHS.  John Eccles was the first known resident of Cranmore House., later John Templton lived on the road. Malone Road is also the home of restaurateur and chef Paul Rankin and television presenters Rose Neill, Donna Traynor, Jim Fitzpatrick and Paul Clarke.
It is presented by Paul Clark or Rose Neill. Shorter bulletins air at other times.
